feed.title: Google Cloud: Dialogflow
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dialogflow

entry.content: **Conversational Agents**: CMEK is now available in EU regions.
entry.summary: CMEK for conversational agents is now available in EU regions.
entry.title: Feature: CMEK now in EU

entry.content: **Conversational Agents**: The [conversational history flow analysis feature](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/conversation-history#flow-analysis-table) is now available.
entry.summary: Analyze conversation history with the new flow analysis feature for conversational agents.
entry.title: Feature: New Flow Analysis Feature

entry.content:
**Conversational Agents**: The [model](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions) `gemini-2.5-flash` is now available in all regions. This change applies to the following features:
* Generators * Playbooks (Public Preview) * Data stores tools (Public Preview)
entry.summary: The Gemini 2.5 Flash model is now available in all regions for features including Generators, Playbooks (Public Preview), and Data Stores tools (Public Preview).
entry.title: Feature: Gemini 2.5 Flash Now Available in All Regions

entry.content: **Conversational Agents data stores**: Conversational Agents now supports AlloyDB, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner and Cloud SQL [data store sources](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/data-store#sources) as public GA features. Microsoft Entra ID source has now private GA support.
entry.summary: Dialogflow CX has added support for several new data store sources, including AlloyDB, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner, and Cloud SQL, as public GA features. Microsoft Entra ID now has private GA support.
entry.title: Feature: New data store sources available in Dialogflow CX

entry.content: **Conversational Agents data stores**: You can now create some data store types directly within the Conversational Agents console rather than needing to use AI Applications. See the [data store creation documentation](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/data-store/handler#data-store-console) for details.
entry.summary: You can now create data stores directly in the Conversational Agents console, simplifying the process. Previously, this required using AI Applications.
entry.title: Feature: Data Stores Now Available in Conversational Agents Console

entry.content: **Conversational Agents**: New [Chirp 3 HD](https://cloud.google.com/text-to-speech/docs/chirp3-hd) Cloud Text-to-Speech voice **Autonoe** is now available.
entry.summary: Autonoe, a new voice from Cloud Text-to-Speech, is now available. This voice is part of the Chirp 3 HD family.
entry.title: Feature: New Autonoe voice available

entry.content: **Conversational Agents**: Conversational Agents console now supports [test cases](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/test-case).
entry.summary: You can now use test cases to test your conversational agents in the console.
entry.title: Feature: Test Cases for Conversational Agents

entry.content: **Conversational Agents**: Service agent access tokens used for authentication by both webhooks and tools are now discontinued as mentioned in notification emails to customers earlier this year. Most customers can use service accounts instead.
entry.summary: Service agent access tokens for conversational agents are no longer supported and have been discontinued. Service accounts are now recommended for authentication.
entry.title: Announcement: Access Tokens for Conversational Agents Discontinued

entry.content: **Data store handlers**: Data store handler use tracking for billing purposes has been corrected.
entry.summary: Tracking for billing purposes in data store handlers has been corrected.
entry.title: Changed: Data store billing tracking corrected
